en.use:
Use for BMI classification of adults and population other than Asians. The frame of reference is as defined by the World Health Organization (WHO):
Below 18,5 - underweight,
18,5-24,9 - normal weight,
25,0-29,9 - pre-obesity,
30,0-34,9 - obesity class I,
35,0 - 39,9 - obesity class II,
Above 40,0 - obesity class III

However, it is also important to consider that it does not distinguish between fat and muscle mass.
It tends to overestimate body fat in individuals with very high muscle mass who are otherwise healthy, and can underestimate it in older adults due to age-related muscle loss. In certain populations, like elite athletes and body-builders, an elevated BMI does not directly correlate to their health status due to their increased muscle mass and weight falsely increasing their BMI.
en.purpose: To categorize individual's BMI based on WHO classification.
en.misuse: Do not use for BMI classification of children and adolescents.

other_details.en: BMI is a simple index of weight-for-height. It is used to identify individuals who are underweight or overweight as defined by WHO classification.
